repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
Mouse popup menus (right-click context menus) did not respect the 'pumborder' option and could overflow screen boundaries when borders were enabled near the edge.

Solution:
Remove the mouse menu exclusion from border rendering. Add boundary check to shift menu left when border would exceed screen width, ensuring complete visibility of menu content and borders.

<!--
  Thank you for contributing to Neovim!
  If this is your first time, check out https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-requests-prs
  for our PR guidelines.
-->

comment_data.body: Grid number should be `> 1` when `send_mouse_grid` is true.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9234,6 +9234,159 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
         end
       end)
     end)
+    it('pumborder with mouse menu displays completely within screen', function()
+      screen:try_resize(40, 12)
+      command('set pumborder=rounded')
+      -- Click near right edge to test boundary handling
+      if send_mouse_grid then
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('right', 'press', '', 0, 2, 35)

comment_data.body: Where does grid 5 come from? The `screen:expect()` above only has 4 grids.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -9234,6 +9234,159 @@ describe('builtin popupmenu', function()
         end
       end)
     end)
+    it('pumborder with mouse menu displays completely within screen', function()
+      screen:try_resize(40, 12)
+      command('set pumborder=rounded')
+      -- Click near right edge to test boundary handling
+      if send_mouse_grid then
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('right', 'press', '', 0, 2, 35)
+      else
+        feed('<RightMouse><35,2>')
+      end
+      if multigrid then
+        screen:expect({
+          grid = [[
+          ## grid 1
+            [2:----------------------------------------]|*11
+            [3:----------------------------------------]|
+          ## grid 2
+            ^                                        |
+            {1:~                                       }|*10
+          ## grid 3
+                                                    |
+          ## grid 4
+            {n:╭─────────────────────╮}|
+            {n:│ Inspect             │}|
+            {n:│                     │}|
+            {n:│ Paste               │}|
+            {n:│ Select All          │}|
+            {n:│                     │}|
+            {n:│ How-to disable mouse│}|
+            {n:╰─────────────────────╯}|
+          ]],
+          win_pos = {
+            [2] = {
+              height = 11,
+              startcol = 0,
+              startrow = 0,
+              width = 40,
+              win = 1000,
+            },
+          },
+          float_pos = {
+            [4] = { -1, 'NW', 2, 3, 17, false, 250, 2, 3, 17 },
+          },
+          win_viewport = {
+            [2] = {
+              win = 1000,
+              topline = 0,
+              botline = 2,
+              curline = 0,
+              curcol = 0,
+              linecount = 1,
+              sum_scroll_delta = 0,
+            },
+          },
+          win_viewport_margins = {
+            [2] = {
+              bottom = 0,
+              left = 0,
+              right = 0,
+              top = 0,
+              win = 1000,
+            },
+          },
+        })
+      else
+        screen:expect([[
+          ^                                        |
+          {1:~                                       }|*2
+          {1:~                }{n:╭─────────────────────╮}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│ Inspect             │}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│                     │}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│ Paste               │}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│ Select All          │}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│                     │}|
+          {1:~                }{n:│ How-to disable mouse│}|
+          {1:~                }{n:╰─────────────────────╯}|
+                                                  |
+        ]])
+      end
+      if send_mouse_grid then
+        api.nvim_input_mouse('move', '', '', 5, 2, 5)

comment_data.body: This zindex condition for `mouse_menu` seems hacky. In Vim there is no need for `pum_redraw()` to special-case the mouse menu at all. Why is it needed in Nvim?
Because it is handled uniformly after parsing pumborder, rather than in pum_position_at_mouse.

> Because it is handled uniformly after parsing pumborder, rather than in pum_position_at_mouse.

What does "it" refer to?

And the zindex combination uniquely identifies mouse menus:
- Regular completion: `State != MODE_CMDLINE` && `zindex == kZIndexPopupMenu`
- Cmdline completion: `State == MODE_CMDLINE` && `zindex == kZIndexCmdlinePopupMenu`  
- Mouse menu: `State != MODE_CMDLINE` && `zindex == kZIndexCmdlinePopupMenu`
Then it's not handled uniformly, as you have a special case for the mouse menu in `pum_redraw()`.
vertical positioning is missing. Handling it uniformly requires some additional checks and it would be easier to do within pum_position_at_mouse. updated.

```suggestion
    it("'pumborder' on mouse-menu displays completely within screen', function()
```

comment_regular_data.body: With this code, with border enabled, my mouse is offset from the selected item by one

repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

title: fix(ui): apply pumborder to mouse menu and prevent overflow
